dimensions: diam. of sphere: ca. 120 cm. (47 1/4 in.)
creditline: The John B. Putnam Jr. Memorial Collection, Princeton University

makers.displaydate: 1926–2025; born Morciano, Emilia Romagna, Italy; died Milan, Italy; active Pesaro, Italy, and Milan, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Arnaldo Pomodoro, 1926–2025; born Morciano, Emilia Romagna, Italy; died Milan, Italy; active Pesaro, Italy, and Milan, Italy

texts.textentryhtml: Arnaldo Pomodoro's Spheres series of the 1960s was characterized by forms partially eaten away by internal erosion. Princeton University has one of the earliest examples of Pomodoro's new spheres, known as Rotanti, or Rotors, and distinguished by their potential mobility.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions 1969", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 29, no. 1 (1970): p. 16-27.
